titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Office of Marketing and Communication records ARCH115
titlestmt.author: Transcribed to ArchivesSpace from word document finding aid by Tiffany Crawford in Jan. 2016, under the supervision of Sean Parke.

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-07-03 15:13:23 -0400.

change.item: People photographs - filed pre-sorted photographs, updated list of people, condensed boxes, and listed boxes by last names.

repository.corpname: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

did.unittitle: Office of Marketing and Communication records

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: University of Hartford. Office of Marketing and Communication

did.abstract: This collection contains subject records and materials generated by the Office of Marketing and Communications at the University of Hartford.

dao.xlink:title: Digital Office of Marketing and Communication records

daodesc.p: Digital Office of Marketing and Communication records

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The majority of the collection is open to all researchers. Some files are restricted to Office of Communication Staff only. Restricted folders are clearly labelled and noted at the file level in the finding aid.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection may be protected by copyright law (U.S. Code: Title 17). Any use of the material which exceeds fair use requires permission from the copyright holder. Researchers are solely responsible for obtaining the proper permission(s) for their use of the material.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: A portion of the collection has been digitized and can be accessed at: http://mdid3.hartford.edu. Access to the digital repository is limited to the University of Hartford Campus. Computers are available to the public at the Harrison Libraries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains reference files on individuals and topics associated with the University of Hartford.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Office of Communication Development, Marketing, and Publicity Collections

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by accession.

controlaccess.corpname: University of Hartford. Office of Marketing and Communication

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Before the days of digital images the University kept extensive photo files of individuals for use in University publications and for press releases. Most individuals connected with the University had formal portraits taken from time to time for these purposes. Most of these images were sent to the archives by the Office of Communications after 2006.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists primarily of portrait photos and some additional informal shots and snapshots. Although most photographs in the collection are of individuals formally associated with the University, the collection also contains photographs of visiting speakers and performers.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The archives contain a number of photograph collections. Additional photographs of individuals may be found within those collections. The document collections in the archives also contain some photographs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The accession is arranged alphabetically by name.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The accession is open to all researchers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The accession contains publications for various marketing publications for various offices, departments, and occassions as well as files on people who were profiled by the University of Hartford or any other publication. The names include those of regents, faculty, staff, alumni, speakers, and special guests among others. Some files include photographs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged into two series: I. People Files, II. Publications.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Rehoused and Rearranged by Tiffany Crawford under the Supervision of Sean Parke in 2016. Previously, these files were their own collection called the "People Collection" or "People Files."The files consist of accessions 2014.2 and 2014.3. It is likely that it contains other undocumented additions as well, as notes indicate that some material was added to the collection by the archives' staff during the year 2014. These additions may or may not have originated from the Office of Marketing and Communications.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The publications series of this accession was processed by volunteer Helen Ingram, Sept - Oct 2016.

did.unittitle: CETA (College of Engineering, Technology, and Architecture)
ISET (Inteegrated Science, Engineering, and Technology Complex)
UHSSE (University High School of Science and Engineering)

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The accession came in one large hanging file folder marked "HCW." The contents appeared as though they may have been intended to be in chronological order, but had several inconsistencies, and one email not regarding HCW. The three filenames were created during processing. A large portion of the material were photocopies of material from the HCW collection in archives. These photocopies were weeded during processing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession consists of records retained by Sharon Scorso. Almost the entire accession is regarding the Hartford College for Women (HCW) and its transition to the WELFund. One email correspondence is regarding a coin collection and the Sherman Museum.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The accession is arranged into three files: General HCW, Articles and clippings, and Correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of photographs, transparencies, slides, and other images used in printing the Observer. Also included, as part of the materials used for the Fall 2001 issue, is an uncorrected advance proof of "Masquerade" by Tivadar Soros, as translated by University President Emeritus Humphrey Tonkin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a University of Hartford flag, a vertical felt banner featuring the University Seal, two bandanas, a T-shirt for UNotes, a small felt pennant, a pair of red and gray gym shorts, and a university of Hartford Frisbee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Consists of two posters for "American Originals" and one for "Empowering Change."
